Legacy Document

Inside Macintosh: Programmer's Guide to MacApp / Part 1 - MacApp Theory and Architecture

Chapter 2 -
Basic Operations

This chapter describes two basic features that are used by all applications built with MacApp:

  • Multiple inheritance. MacApp is written in C++, with broad support for multiple inheritance. Many of MacApp's key classes use multiple inheritance, so your classes that descend from MacApp classes will use it too.
  • The TObject class. The TObject class is the common ancestor for most classes in the MacApp class library. Among other things it provides support for runtime type information (RTTI) operations, creating and deleting objects, and establishing dependency relationships between objects.
